intro: Wamalchitamia yautepecana, commonly known as the Yautepecan plant, is a flowering shrub native to the mountainous regions of southern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
